titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. R. H. Buckley, Indictment
CWG7014

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Henry Circuit Court
Sept Term 1865
Commonwealth of Ky
against } Indictment
R H Buckley Deft
This day came the atty for the Comth also the atty for the deft who plead not guilty and to try the Issue Joined ten come a Jury to wit --
O J Krack John James Robt Cooper Wm Black Wiford Chilton E M Baskete James Pearce John Mahorney Joshua Sewell Robt Johnson Blaek Chilton & John Clarke --
who were duly Elected tried and sworn and return into Court the following verdict
We of the Jury find the defendent guilty and assess his fine at forty Dollars

It is therefore considered by the Court that the Plff the Comth of Ky recover of R H Buckly the Sum of forty dollars the amt by the jury assessed and the cost herein Expended -- And thereupon came the atty for the Comth and in open Court released the Said Buckly from the payment of His part of the fine in this Case --

Copy Attst
Geo T Hamston Ck H C C
New Castle Ky
Sept 16th 1865

Henry Cir Ct
vs
Comth of Ky.
vs } Copy order
R H Buckley
$540.
Remitted 19th Oct 1865
